titles.title: PROTECT Act of 2017
PROTECT Act of 2017
Providing Rewards for Outstanding Tips to Expose Crimes in Technology Act of 2017
Providing Rewards for Outstanding Tips to Expose Crimes in Technology Act of 2017

To direct the Attorney General to create a special reward program for individuals providing information leading to the apprehension and conviction of persons committing offenses under section 1030 of title 18, United States Code, and for other purposes.
PROTECT Act of 2017

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.

committee.subcommittee: Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary:
Providing Rewards for Outstanding Tips to Expose Crimes in Technology Act of 2017 or the PROTECT Act of 2017
This bill directs the Department of Justice to establish and publicize a cybercrime reward program for individuals who provide information leading to the apprehension and conviction of persons who commit certain computer crimes.
